item.description:

item.title: Loud Noise nuisance, 29th September
item.description:

item.title: Shopping trolley full of black bags in Victoria Road Erith., 29th September
item.description:
Yet again a shopping trolley has been left outside Christchurch in Victoria Road next to the yellow bin. Black bags are also on the pavement and have been ripped open by foxes. Can you please remove the bags and trolley. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Endless flytipping, 29th September
item.description:

item.title: 4th repost 1 foot by 4 foot pothole - CHARLTONPARKACADEMY (Main Pedestrian entrance), 29th September
item.description:
A pavement repair has worn away much quicker then the rest of the pavement due to inferior fill material. Mobility and wheelchair users have fallen into the road because of the uneven surface. We are worried that the council will get sued or bought into disrepute by failing to deal with the access issues in to a disability school. RBG has marked this as fixed but nothing has changed/ been filled.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Park Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 1 foot by 4 foot pothole - CHARLTONPARKACADEMY, 29th September
item.description:
Some corrosion on the path outside the school entrance which is causing a lot of problems for wheelchair users trying to enter the school. This is a big health and safety problem for students/ members of public entering the school this has been reported 3 times all ready and is being closed with out the problem being fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Park Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
